transcripts.text: We have to talk about a complete and total change in the structures of this society because that's the only way that a concept like academic freedom is going to be made relevant.  We have to go to the streets.  The Berkeley campus has perhaps the most unique tradition of political activity.  You have continually assumed the political responsibility of responding to acts of repression and have been capable of involving the masses of the students on this campus in demonstrative political actions.  If only for this reason, I feel very proud to be able to speak to you today.

What Angela Davis had to say here at UC Berkeley was no different from what many other radicals have said.  Her only problem seems to be that she's given herself a label.  She calls herself a member of the Communist Party.  Velva Davis for Eyewitness News, UC Berkeley.

They didn't have to identify themselves as pigs because anyone on the street caught from this moment forward molesting anyone you did who doesn't have on a sentence to nine months imprisonment and three years probation.

The racist, hunky dog judge.  sit up there.  I believe that the fight is just beginning to start.  The fight against all those who want to make your university a training school for the perpetuation of a society the security of which and the prosperity of which is based on the oppression and enslavement of other peoples within the national frontiers and without.  The fight against these powers must go on because it is a fight for you.
